|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 24KEc |cpu1_type_rev = |cpu1spd = 580 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = GigaDevice;GD25Q80BSIG; |flash1size = 1 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 8 |ram1chip = Winbond;W9864G6JH-6; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = B8:55:10 |oui = B8:55:10 |bootwait = |stockbootloader = |stockos = |exp_if_types = |exp_sim_num = |exp_pcmcia_num = |exp_expcard_num = |exp_minipci_num = |exp_minipcie_num = |exp_usb_num = |exp_cf_num = |exp_sdmmc_num = |exp_ide_num = |exp_ata_num = |exp_sata_num = |exp_esata_num = |exp_parallel = |exp_sfp_num = |exp_M.2 = |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 9 |pwr_amp_dc = 0.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = CD-R KING_MAC_SN |defaultssid_regex = ^CD-R KING_`MAC SN`RE$ |default_ch = |manuf = Zioncom |manuf_model = IP04220 |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = |availability = Philippines only |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = |estreldate = 06/06/2013 |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "04220B" is silkscreened on the board. This is confirmed to be a [[Zioncom]] IP04220. :;Rebrands/Variations * [[TOTOLINK N200RE]] (IP04220) * [[CD-R KING]] WR-NET-024-ZI (IP04220) {{See also|CD-R KING CW-5356U}} :;Default Configurations This router's default SSID is not uniform. It's the brand name & the last 3 octets :of the wireless MAC address ''"CD-R KING_MAC_SN"''. :;Firmware Zioncom IP04220 firmware differences between variations. :Brand images and a few details are different while everything else is the same. You can upgrade from the shipped CD-R KING OS V1.4 to TOTOLINK's [https://drivers.softpedia.com/get/Router-Switch-Access-Point/TOTOLINK/TOTOLINK-N200RE-V1-Router-Firmware-15020150725.shtml latest V1.5 OS] :(Tested and confirmed to be much more stable/secure). :;Support Due to lack of firmware updates on both the main website and tech support, this device is known :for its instability. CD-R King has a youtube channel that provides technical assistance. ==Links of Interest== :[https://web.archive.org/web/20191115095427/http://www.cdrking.com/?mod=products&type=view&sid=16034&main=50 Product page] (archive) '''Note:''' A typographical error was made on the product page indicating model number WR-NET-023-ZI,
but the device's management page shows WR-NET-024-ZI ===Serial=== There is a populated and marked serial port header on the board. :Pinout for the serial port (header J2) is marked - [Vcc] [Tx] [Rx] [GND] :- from the orientation found on top of the board. ==Pictures==
'''User Images''' File:CD-R_KING_WR-NET-024-ZI.jpeg|CD-R King Variant Image Reference (Front View) File:CD-R_KING_WR-NET-024-ZI-Rear_View.jpeg|CD-R King Variant Image Reference (Rear View) File:TOTOLINK-N200RE-V1.1-TOP.jpg|Top view of a CD-R KING WR-NET-024-ZI File:IP04220-UI-CDRKING.PNG|CD-R KING WR-NET-024-ZI User Interface
